reviews.text: The building itself actually looks like a palace... The inside as well and each exhibition is better than its predecessor 😀🎉 a must when visiting Lausanne 😀🇨🇭

A pretty spot in central Lausanne with a museum inside. The museum sometimes has special exhibits so it's good to look up the museum online and see what's on. The museum had an odd layout so make sure to grab a map. It'll come in handy.

A very classic European style museum. A great value (it's free!), housed in a beautiful historical building. I didn't necessarily see anything I haven't seen before in other museums, but it was still a good way to pass a few hours in Lausanne.

Amazing museums in a palace setting. They have 4 to 5 different museums here. The entry is free to all! It is typically a 2h visit around all the museums, but can be extended longer if a certain part of the museum is of more interest.
It’s really worth to visit 😊

Small museum in the center of Lausanne. Good spot to spend couple of hours and educate yourself. Nicely placed exhibitions on three levels of the building makes you think, that it is a huge place but it is not. The first day of the new exhibition can be overcrowded.

Only $5 with a student card and just big enough to spend an hour or so depending on your speed (and how hot it is outside). Loved the current exhibit on firearms and am thoroughly satisfied with the experience!
Great building with a rather odd mix of old archaeological finds and Modern Art

What a great little museum. I came for a couple of hours and I have stayed for four. At the time there was a major exhibition about a city in India, where its citizens lived out of making glass artifacts. Both this and the permanent collection was mesmerizing and enlightening. It's opposite to the Cathedral. Make sure you visit.
This design museum has the most interesting exhibitions in Lausanne

This tower is close to the Place de la Palud. It dates from the 14th century and it used to be part of the city walls which no longer exist.  It was closed (apparently it always is, therefore you can only take photos from the outside).  If you catch métro line 2 all the way to the "M.Béjart" stop you can reach this tower in 10-15 minutes.
Is a tower, could not enter
Nothing to see. It's a tower but you can't get in.
Great
Voici le dernier témoin important des fortifications médiévales de Lausanne. Cette tour de 21 mètres de hauteur protégeait la quartier de l'Ale, qui à l'époque était en dehors des murs de la ville.
Pleasant and informative
Cool expos

An interesting museum but fairly small and thus pricy if visited without a Swiss Museum Pass or on the first Saturday of the month when admission is free. Other museums in the larger Lake Geneva region covers Roman history in Switzerland far more extensive.

It's rather...
Spartan
The exhibits inside are impressive but outside........meh

First time in this well known museum. We spend 2 hours, but as an adult I could have spent another 2h more, reading and learning about the history of the games.
The kids were interested, jumping from one exhibit to the other. 
The good news was the ability to buy a family entry ticket for a reduced price, instead of individual entry fees.
The bad news was that we did not take the audio guides because it was sooo expensive. 😳

This is one of my all time favorite museums of all time. As opposed to stereotypical museums where they display artifacts in a bland, one dimensional way, the Olympic museum includes a wealth of interactive exhibits, put together in extremely interesting, tasteful, engaging, and educational ways. If you are at all interested in the Olympics, you will not be disappointed in your visit.

The Olympic Museum is a really nice couple of hours of walking. You do get to visually see how some of these world records look in real life. They are just incredible and it shocks you. The grounds are really nice and there are statues you can't climb on so children may need to be kept a close eye on. I found it really interesting and fascinating and I'm sure you will too.

Wasn't sure if I would regret spending 18CHF on entry, but am super glad I decided to go. I normally get bored quickly at museums, but this one had a lot of cool artifacts, interesting videos, and interactive exhibits. I especially liked the history behind the Olympic torches and seeing the real thing! The highlight videos of each Olympic games were also a great history lesson, and seeing medalists' costumes and equipment was cool (Michael Phelps' Athens swimsuit is there!). Would definitely recommend.

I was pleasantly surprised by this museum. As a person who is not a huge fan of museums in general, I had low expectations for this place, but since everything was closed on Sundays in the city, it was the obvious choice to visit. It had a lot of history and cool outfits from the past Olympians to look at and had a lot of interactive features. I would highly recommend if you're in the city, and especially if you love museums or the Olympic games.
Staff is always very welcoming, kind and pleasant. The galettes are pretty average but the suggestions are usually well worth it. The cider is excellent.
Great food, Great service... can't wait to return!

My absolute favorite place in the world to eat crepes. Very cosy atmosphere in a historic building, delicious crepes for a fair price, various choice of drink (teas, ciders, etc). Just go! But better make a reservation first.
Amazing crepes but the menus is a bit confusing and the chocolate was not the best
Good food for a good price, cute little place with friendly staff.
Not a huge fan of it, I prefer other burgers but it's just me. I have to recommend it since it isn't bad. I just feel like there are better places that offer burgers.
Great flavour and quality, but basically exactly what you would expect though for a 20fr burger and fries combo. Only have 2 beers on offer but at least it is Dr Gabs so quality
Fast food with big portions (compared to average) and very good price/quality ratio. Good level of service.

Visited it on a Saturday evening. We chose the student menu offer "Big Cheese" for 15 something chf, a really good deal for Switzerland. The burger is really tasty and served with a generous portion of delicious fries. Unlimited ketchup and mayo seal the deal for a wonderful meal. My go-to option for a burger in Lausanne. Also the place is really nice to sit and have a chat. Deserves a visit.

The Swiss Burger Franchise, that is how it was sold to me! 

The burgers are priced on the premium side but the good news is they taste fantastic. 

worth a go... particularly if someone else is paying!

They make you pay 2.- per person for a jug of tap water... Ridiculous. The manager is not even capable of doing a commercial gesture when its customers are complaining about that. Avoid this place even though the food is tasty.
You should try the pizza with Mascarpone amazing   ...
Expensive food is no good I don't recommend it
Bad service. Unfriendly staff. Low quality food
This place was weird
Great brunch and delicious club sandwich. Staff is friendly and reactive. Cute terrace, great for Sunday chill out with friends

This was quite possibly one of our best meals while in Switzerland. We found it on Google and were not disappointed by the reviews. The place has a local flare, very crowded. Staff was courteous and patient with us as Americans.  There were 8 of us, so we needed a big table. We ordered ham and cheese crepes, French toast, and chocolate crepes, champagne, and Cokes. The waiter was adorable and on top of things. The crepes were perfection and served with a lovely salad. The French toast was better than any French toast ever eaten!!! The price was average for the area. It was a memorable meal and enjoyed by all of us!!!

Went to Café de Grancy for a company dinner
Food was a delicacy without being unnecessarily complicated. I loved it!
Waitresses were a bit busy in large and lovely (noisy) room. 
It's crowded most nights, so think to book your table in advance.

I will always love to come to this amazing #fairspot and have their locally sourced food that is simply amazing; tasty and looking great at the same time. All of their furniture is upcycled and the space is so cozy that you forget the business of the life and would have the desire to stay for longer periods of time.
Lots of friendly people that live in the area are there, so be sure to ask for directions, or simply start a conversation and meet a life friend.
Great trendy place (book in advance!) Delicious food and big portions. Swiss prices but reasonable.

Known for Mexican dishes. The interiors were well maintained, spacious (large room, 100 💺).
The staff was sincere, communicative, cordial and knowledgeable.
As the crowd increases in the evening, be ready for sitting around and waiting to pay 💰.
Excellent food, odd location for the restroom
The have alcohol-free cocktails and vegetarian menus.

I like this restaurant. It is colorful and noisy like Mexicans! The food is really good (never been to Mexico so cannot certify if original or not but I like it). Expensive but you have enough in the plate, which is very good for big eaters like me. The service has always been nice and efficient. I recommend.
Good food in huge quantities, nice service, and setting ok. Gets noisy compared to some other restaurants but makes it alive.

Excellent fondue 😍 the fondue menu is perfect.
The place is really old and typical, it is very nice. The waitress was really kind and we had a wonderfull diner there!

Pinte Besson used to be a Lausanne staple, serving arguably the best fondue in the city. Unfortunately, with the popularity of the restaurant the quality of the food has severely diminished over time. The portions for fondue have been cut in half (maintaining the same price) and the restaurant now charges for side dishes. While Pinte Besson may be coasting on the number of people seeing positive reviews online, the place is now devoid of locals and the loyal customers it used to serve. I sincerely hope this place is able to regain its former identity and become Lausanne's best fondue again.

Rude staff and impossible seating arrangements!

I made a reservation for 6 people three weeks before coming to the restaurant on a Tuesday night. We actually ended up arriving with 5 people as one person cancelled and were walked to our table for 6.
The table was that small, right next to the entrance and the wall that it was IMPOSSIBLE to sit down with 5 persons. Two people of our group had to get up for every single person who wanted to pass (again, the table was right next to the entrance) and the other 3 people had to cross legs and sit sideways next to the table as the wall did not permit to sit properly. After 3 minutes we asked the waitress if there was no other option. She could have not cared less and told us that this is the way it is and that traditional restaurants in Switzerland and simply narrow. She was rude and annoyed by our request. We then decided to leave and we had an amazing fondue that night at Grütli in Lausanne.
Recommendation for the restaurant: if the space is narrow this is how it is BUT business should be done accordingly, meaning to accept the right amount of reservations. It is the same as buying a Smart Car and expecting to fit 7 family members in there - it does not work!
Swiss food restaurant, where you can try good dishes from the region. The price is good as well, taking into account that it's Switzerland. The place is old and authentic!
Nice restaurant with very good food. I highly recommend the steak on ardoise. The meringue with double crème for desert is always good!
Lovely little place, try to book in advance. Waiters are fantastic, all very charming and friendly. Food superb, just like being back in Italy.
Very gooood food, very good selection of wine, tray made up with meatballs and beef plus vegetables is yummy

Amazing fresh pasta and lovely ambiance.
Waiters are attentionate and charming (all of them are italian)
Highly recomended!!!
Just the best Italian restaurant in Lausanne. You can tell it's great by the relaxed welcoming friendliness of the waiters. Everything is delicious and original.
Great food! Great prices!
Fabtastic sushi, very good service. Small space but well managed, prices in line with higher class Swiss restaurant.
Always a pleasure! Come early to avoid the noise of too many people in this cosy place. And better book your seats!
A very nice place for Japanese food in Lausanne

Pleasant place if you crave for some Japanese food around. 
Food are tasty though not so authentic however in Lausanne among one of the best we can get ;)
Super fresh sushi and very attentive service and a great location away from the bustle of Flon.
Perfection: the view of the mountains, the service, extremely generous nibbles, the gorgeous ingredients and presentation. Just lovely...
Excellent food. Team is really caring and accommodating even when you are on food diet. Excellent fishes.
Excellent food..lovely atmosphere.. great staff
Really good food, even better service.  We ordered four dishes for two people, and it was ok to share.  The staff was very friendly and did their level best to understand my friend's English.
Amazing Italian food with a magnificent view!
Perfection in every respect! A unique and unforgettable experience!
Amazing restaurant, fantastic food, and great service. Its definitely the best restaurant I have been to, and can't imagine that there is better then this place.

Top rated restaurant in Switzerland ! With chef Giovanni, the restaurant Hôtel de Ville de Crissier offer a very high taste of gastronomic wonder in a beautiful and warm environment. A must try if you are a gastronome.
Lovely seafood and great service. Cooks are serious about their food and their cooking.
One of the best restaurant in Switzerland. Food is very much tasty and service is perfect. Highly recomended.
